polanyi-tacit.author: Michael Polanyi
polanyi-tacit.title: The Tacit Dimension
polanyi-tacit.summary: Polanyi argues that much of human knowledge is 'tacit' - we know more than we can tell. This challenges attempts to codify all organizational knowledge.
polanyi-tacit.keyQuote: We can know more than we can tell.
polanyi-tacit.relevance: Core critique of traditional knowledge management systems that assume all knowledge can be documented.

nonaka-knowledge-creating.author: Ikujiro Nonaka
nonaka-knowledge-creating.title: The Knowledge-Creating Company
nonaka-knowledge-creating.summary: Introduces the SECI model (Socialization, Externalization, Combination, Internalization) for organizational knowledge creation.
nonaka-knowledge-creating.critique: Misunderstands Polanyi - treats tacit knowledge as convertible to explicit. Externalization is often impossible, not just difficult.
nonaka-knowledge-creating.relevance: Popular but flawed KM model. Understanding its limits is crucial.

kabat-zinn-mindfulness.author: Jon Kabat-Zinn
kabat-zinn-mindfulness.title: Full Catastrophe Living
kabat-zinn-mindfulness.summary: Introduces Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) with 7 foundational attitudes applicable to knowledge work.
kabat-zinn-mindfulness.keyQuote: You can't stop the waves, but you can learn to surf.
kabat-zinn-mindfulness.relevance: Alternative epistemology for knowledge work - non-judging, beginner's mind, patience. Ancient wisdom reframed for modern context.

kegan-in-over-our-heads.author: Robert Kegan
kegan-in-over-our-heads.title: In Over Our Heads
kegan-in-over-our-heads.summary: Describes stages of adult cognitive development from Socialized to Self-Authoring to Self-Transforming mind.
kegan-in-over-our-heads.keyInsight: Most adults never reach self-authoring, fewer reach self-transforming. Development requires specific challenges, not just information.
kegan-in-over-our-heads.relevance: Can we accelerate development through education? Or does wisdom require lived experience?

collins-be-20.author: Jim Collins & Bill Lazier
collins-be-20.title: Beyond Entrepreneurship 2.0
collins-be-20.summary: Framework for organizational knowledge architecture: Vision → Mission → Values → BHAG → Strategy → OKRs → Tasks.
collins-be-20.relevance: Aspirational skeleton vs. operational reality. Organizations struggle with 'what did we decide yesterday?' not 'what's our vision?'

kuhn-structure.author: Thomas Kuhn
kuhn-structure.title: The Structure of Scientific Revolutions
kuhn-structure.summary: Science progresses through paradigm shifts, not steady accumulation. 'Normal science' operates within unquestioned assumptions.
kuhn-structure.keyInsight: Different paradigms are incommensurable - scientists in different paradigms literally see different worlds.
kuhn-structure.relevance: Academic vs. startup knowledge are different paradigms. 'Marketing isn't science' is paradigm thinking, not truth.

krishnamurti-freedom.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
krishnamurti-freedom.title: Freedom from the Known
krishnamurti-freedom.summary: Accumulated knowledge becomes a prison that prevents seeing reality freshly. True observation requires freedom from past conditioning.
krishnamurti-freedom.keyQuote: The ability to observe without evaluating is the highest form of intelligence.
krishnamurti-freedom.relevance: No paper in Nature, yet profound wisdom. Alternative to epistemic gatekeeping.

seligman-learned-optimism.author: Martin Seligman
seligman-learned-optimism.title: Learned Optimism
seligman-learned-optimism.summary: Optimism is not a fixed trait but an explanatory style that can be learned. Introduces the 3 P's: Permanence, Pervasiveness, Personalization.
seligman-learned-optimism.keyInsight: Knowledge constructed through new lens, not 'discovered'. Practical application changes outcomes.
seligman-learned-optimism.relevance: Example of paradigm creation within psychology itself - studying flourishing vs. pathology.
